FacilityStr1: 22 miles N of Graver TX on Hwy 207

_exec_summary.SummaryText: THE OWNERS, MANAGEMENT, AND EMPLOYEES OF ATTEBURY GRAIN INC. AT BERNSTEIN ARE COMMITTED TO THE PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.  IF AN ACCIDENTAL RELEASE SHOULD OCCUR, THE FACILITY IS PREPARED TO WORK WITH THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT OR OTHER AUTHORTIES, TO MITIGATE ANY RELEASE AND MINIMIZE THE IMPACT OF THE RELEASE TO PEOPLE AND THE ENVIROMENT.--THE PRIMARY ACTIVITY AT THE FACILITY IS THE STORAGE OF GRAIN FROM FARMER AND THE STORAGE OF FERTILIZER FOR SALE TO FARMERS.--ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IS RECIEVED, STORED, AND DISTRIBUTED FOR DIRECT APPLICATION FOR CROP PRODUCTION.--THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY STORED WOULD BE 56,078 POUNDS IN OUR ON 12,000 GAL. STORAGE TANK.  THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY HANDLED WOULD BE THE UNLOADING OF A TANKER TRUCK HOLDING 44,000 POUNDS.--THE WORST--CASE RELEASE SCENARIO WOULD BE THE RELEASE OF THE TOTAL CONTENTS OF THE STORAGE TANK RELEASED AS A GAS OBER 10 MINUTES.  THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY RELEASED WOULD BE 56,078 POUNDS, WHICH REPRESENTS THE VOLUME OT THELARGEST STORAGE TANK AT 85% PERCENT CAPACITY AS LIMITED BY DESIGN STANDARDS.  THE DISTANCE TO THE ENDPOINT IS 1.63 MILES.--THE ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIO BASED ON THE MOST LIKELY POTENTIAL INCIDENT IS A RELEASE FROM A BREAK IN A TRANSFER HOSE.  THE DISTANCE TO THE ENDPOINT IS 0.01 MILES.--THE FACILITY HAS IMPLEMENTED THE PROVISIONS OF "SAFETY REQUIREMENTS FOR THE STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA,  K-A1.1".PUBLISHED BY THE AMERICAN NATIONAL STANDARDS INSTITUTE, INC. AND THE STANDARDS OF THE U.S. OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH ADMINISTRATION (OSHA), THE 29 CFR 1910.111, STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA".--THE FOLLOWING IS A LIST OF ACCIDENTAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IN THE PAST FIVE YEARS THAT HAS BEEN NO ACCIDENTS TO REPORT.--THE FACILITY HAS: A. A WRITTEN EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN IN ACCORDANCE WITH OSHA STANDARD 29 CFR 1910.38; B. PROVIDED STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES THE EMERGENCY PLANNING AND COMMUNITY RIGHT-TO-KNOW INFORMATION AS REQUIRED UNDER SARA TITLE III.

; C. A WRITTEN EVERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM, IN ACCORDANCE WITH OSHA STANDARD 29 CFR 1910.120, INCLUDING PRE-EMERGENCY PLANNING AND EMPLOYEE TRAINING.---SAFETY IMPROVEMENT IS AN ON-GOING PROGESS AT THE FACILITY.  PERIOCIC EVALUATIONS ARE PREFORMED  TO ASSESS THE MAINTENANCE OF SAFE CONDITIONS.  THERE ARE NO ADDITIONAL SPECIFIC ANHYDROUS AMMONIA SAFETY RECOMMENDATIONS FOR IMPLEMENTATION AT THIS TIME.
